answers.author: Yvette Blackford
answers.text:
The City of Sunnyvale allows alcohol at City parks and at one community facility. 
The only facility that permits alcoholic beverages is the heritage center building; beer, wine, and champagne are the only alcoholic beverages permitted in the facility. The use of alcoholic beverages must be requested at the time the reservation is made or up to 30 days prior to the event date and an alcohol damage deposit is required.
The City’s policy on alcohol at parks is simple – alcohol is permitted in the picnic areas only in conjunction with a meal. Alcohol is limited to beer, wine and champagne. Hard alcohol, including “mixed” drinks and “cocktails” are not permitted in the parks.
I’m attaching our Administrative Policy, Chapter 6, Article 8, Use of City Facilities for Meetings & Activities.

author: Michael Grebosz
text: The City of DeLand is looking into allowing alcoholic beverages at its parks and recreation facilites (i.e. community buidlings, park pavilions, etc...). Currently, alcoholic beverages are not allowed at these facilites. Are there any samples of policies that are available that can be utilized to help form a draft policy?
title: Alcoholic Beverage Policy for City Park Facilities
